p: Another central regulator of immune responses at the epithelium as well as immune cells is the NF-ÎºB signaling pathway. Accordingly, IAV has evolved several mechanisms to modulate this pathway to counteract antiviral responses including directly targeting the IkB kinase (IKK) ( 62, 63). SC75741 is a potent NFkB inhibitor that functions by reducing the ability of the p65 subunit of the NFkB complex to bind DNA; thereby limiting its transcription-regulating functions ( 64, 65). In vivo administration of SC75741 at 4 days after lethal infection with either H5N1 or H7N7 avian viruses resulted in significant protection with most mice surviving and showing little to no clinical symptoms; similar results were obtained by prophylactic administration ( 27).
